ETYMOLOGY: From Old French enquerre, from Latin inquirere (in- 'into' + quaerere 'seek'). Related to 'inquire', which is the predominant spelling in American English.

MEANINGS.PATTERN: enquire [about sth] | enquire [after sb/sth] | enquire [of sb]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: v.intr. (intransitive verb) - a verb that does not take a direct object; its action is complete without one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To ask someone for information about something or someone; to make an investigation or seek information.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 向某人询问某事或某人的信息；进行调查或寻求信息。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I will enquire about the availability of the rooms at the hotel.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我将询问酒店房间的空房情况。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: v.intr. (intransitive verb) - a verb that does not take a direct object; its action is complete without one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make an official investigation into something, often an incident or allegation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某事（通常是事件或指控）进行正式调查。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The committee was formed to enquire into the causes of the accident.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该委员会的成立是为了调查事故原因。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: v.intr. (intransitive verb) - a verb that does not take a direct object; its action is complete without one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To ask a question to determine if something is true or if a particular condition exists.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 提问以确定某事是否属实或特定条件是否存在。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She wanted to enquire whether he had received her message.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她想询问他是否收到了她的信息。

REGISTER: Formal or semi-formal. Primarily used in British English; 'inquire' is more common in American English for all meanings.
